file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-12-15-04 - MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM RESTRICTOR VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM RESTRICTOR VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT LR MODEL WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the restrictor valve of the main-door actuation system. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT LR MODEL MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM RE- WITH AIRSTAIRS 52-12-15-000-801-A STRICTOR VALVE - REMOVAL DOOR AIRCRAFT LR MODEL MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM RE- WITH AIRSTAIRS 52-12-15-400-801-A STRICTOR VALVE - INSTALLATION DOOR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-12-15 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-12-15-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT LR MODEL WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 2. MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM RESTRICTOR VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the restrictor valve of the main-door actuation system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114CR Nose hydraulic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose hydraulic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Open access door 114CR of the nose hydraulic compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-15 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Totally release the pressure from the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (4) Totally release the pressure from the fluid chamber of the hydraulic accumulator of the main-door actuation system. For this, open the discharge valve and monitor the pressure gage until it shows the nitrogen precharge. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Disconnect the hydraulic tube (4). (2) Remove the restrictor valve (3) from the fitting block (1). (3) Remove and discard the old O-ring (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-15 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT LR MODEL WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR Restrictor Valve - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE ACCESS 114 114CR DET. A B 1 2 3. RESTRICTOR 2. O-RING VALVE THERMAL RELIEF VALVE (REF.) 4. HYDRAULIC TUBE 1. FITTING BLOCK DET. B 1 TORQUE: 17.51 - 18.64 N.m (155 - 165 lb.in) 2 TORQUE: 29.4 - 31.6 N.m (260 - 280 lb.in) EM145AMM520424A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-12-15 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-12-15-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT LR MODEL WITH AIRSTAIRS DOOR 3. MAIN-DOOR ACTUATION-SYSTEM RESTRICTOR VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the restrictor valve of the main-door actuation system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200 EMDP IPC 52-12-00 MAIN DOOR - LIFTING AND LOWERING SYSTEM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 114 114CR Nose hydraulic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 available Fluid-Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 available Base, Fluid-Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) O-ring IPC 52-12-00 1 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Nose hydraulic compartment EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-12-15 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Put the new O-ring (2) in the restrictor valve (3). (2) Install the restrictor valve (3) to the fitting block (1). NOTE: Make sure that the arrow marked in the valve body stays in a position where you can see it and that it is pointed to the solenoid valve. (3) Connect the hydraulic tube (4). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) Pressurize hydraulic system 1 ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-802-A/200). (3) Do a check on the restrictor valve for leaks. (4) Close access panel 114CR of the nose hydraulic compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-12-15 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
